intro: Impatiens aitchisonii, commonly known as the Kashmir impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Pakistan, India, and Afghanistan. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
